attributes.action: Create a system to enable willing members of the public house Syrian refugees.
attributes.additional_details:
I ask for those who are willing and able, to show the government that we want to help house Syrian refugees. We need a system, similar to the one set up by German volunteers 'Refugees Welcome', that enables willing volunteers to offer temporary/long term shelter to the most vulnerable of asylum seekers, whilst our Government gets its act together on resettling these families.

Germany & Iceland are looking to take in 10,000 survivors each of the Syrian war. What is Britain doing other than aid?
attributes.background: The people fleeing Syria need shelter and refuge. The victims in Syria are dying from war, not starvation. This is not a migration issue. It is a humanitarian issue and with 6.5 million Syrian's displaced, asylum is the key. The British public can help. Aid is not enough any more.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106997

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
